Reviews.Content: A lovely place to retreat We booked here based on our reviews on Trip Advisor and we weren't disappointed.The hotel arranged a pick up from the airport for us (isn't this welcoming when you arrive in a foreign country) and from this introduction to our leaving, we were always made to feel more than welcome.We stayed at one of the poolside rooms which was extremely spacious. The basin area was separate from the main bathroom which I always think is a great idea. It was clean and always well maintained.What is really sad is that people just aren't going to Bali (the Australian government are warning their countrymen against going - after the bombing (the bombers were executed a couple of weeks before we arrived)). Our hotel was only half full so the restaurant did lack atmosphere. The location of the hotel was perfect for us - on the main tourist road in Sanur (which you never heard) so easy to do shopping and visit restaurants plus close to the beach.
Reviews.Author: fredic

Reviews.Content: Not so Tamukami       the superior room
Reviews.Author: abooz

Reviews.Content: Wonderful stay We stayed at the Tamukami for two nights at the end of our trip to Bali. Everything was perfect, from the hospitable welcome drink to the efficiency and friendliness of the staff. We arranged to do a tour with a member of the hotel staff who was friendly, very helpful and knowledgeable. The highlight of our stay was our dinner at Alise's restaurant complete with live music - there was a great family atmosphere and the hotel owners were very attentive and friendly. We will definitely come back to this hotel next time we are in Bali.
Reviews.Author: LauraLLondon

Reviews.Content: Best place to stay in Sanur I just came back from a 3 day stay in Bali. I chose Tamukami, Sanur after reading all reviews in Tripadvisor. I thought I better write a review and share my experience.First of all a big thanks to all previous reviewers. I could not have stayed in a better place in Sanur than Tamukami. Its literally a paradise in Sanur. I stayed in a Superior room. The room was extremely big. Bathroom was huge. Pool area looks great. Cleanliness is excellent. Despite being priced competitively, the room has all the facilities you would enjoy in a resort hotel in Nusa Dua.The breakfast in the morning was very good. You get to chose the style of breakfast. Home made bread is served as well. I went for few tours and took the car with driver from the hotel itself. It was really worth it. The driver (Wayang) was a fantastic guy. He could speak average english and was kind enough to suggest the right places to visit. He helped to take a lot of pics too.Over and all, Tamukami made my stay in Bali a memorable one. I am sure I would chose no other place other than Tamukami when I go back to Bali.
Reviews.Author: v_venkie

Reviews.Content: a gem in sanur we stayed for 10 nights from the19th nov.we arrived at night so it was just great to get changed and relax with af ree welcome cocktail.the hotel was like a little tropical paradise.we booked this hotel after reading the other reviews but i must say that i was very surprised at how nice and friendly the staff were.the photos of the hotel do not do it justice it is better when you see it in real life.the rooms were spotless and large,breakfast was great and the pool area was terrific.i must admit that bali was not what i expected but if i was going back this hotel would be fist on my list as it is a wonderful smallish balinese gem.
Reviews.Author: allanhFife

Reviews.Content: Great location at a good price       Terrace
Reviews.Author: Happynoodleboy_uk

Reviews.Content: Value for money We booked to stay here after reading the reviews on Tripadvisor. I was a little unsure, but I'm so glad I went ahead and booked. We stayed in one of the suites for $70 per night including breakfast. The room was a great size. It had the biggest bed I have ever seen! It was cleaned every day and was spottless. The staff were very helpful and professional. The restaurant is also great. It was one of the best meals we had in Sanur. The pool and gardens are very pretty, and make for a lovely day lying in the sun. There is plenty of shade for the midday sun! My only dissappointement with Sanur was that it was very quiet. Many of the restaurants were empty, and everywhere seemed to shut around 10.30pm.If you're looking for a nice evening out try Jimbaran bay - the sunset is lovely and there are great restaurants lining the beach all serving freshly caught barbequed fish. Haggle with them on price and make sure you pick a busy restaurant (this makes sure the fish is fresh from that day). Also check out the italian restaurant at the other end of Sanur called Massimo.
Reviews.Author: HStuart

Reviews.Content: What a find! We have been regular travellers to Bali for the past 14 years and have stayed at various hotels but to find the Tamukami was the jewel in the crown. The excellent services and exceptional friendliness was outstanding. We stayed in a bungalow and the size was very comfortable. Each morning after breakfast on our return to the room our room had been cleaned and refreshed. This was always at a very high standard. It is also good to know that the tourists dollar stays in Bali. It is without a doubt a true treasure in Sanur! Highly recommended!
Reviews.Author: starrs_ra

Reviews.Content: Paradise in bali Just returned from a second honeymoon at this beautyful hotel, an oasis of harmony in the busy Bali, Sanur. At walking distance from the beach, you still are tempted to stay inside the premises. The restaurant is top quality, we saw people not staying at the hotel coming back to it several times, no burnt BBQ like you often get at the beach. The staff are friendly and you can talk to them unlike at the big chain hotels. The owners are a Belgian couple and they add that touch of perfection to the local culture.Highly recommended.
Reviews.Author: Grimmert_of_old

Reviews.Content: Fantastic spot (don't tell anyone!)       Tamukami pool
Reviews.Author: I'madesertgirl

Reviews.Content: Wonderful Stay in Boutique Paridise We had five nights at this small but charming hotel with a lovely central pool and had a fantastic stay.This was our second visit to the hotel having staying a few years ago in a standard room upstairs.This time we stayed in a Bungalow room over looking the pool with a small patio to sit on and take in the well tended gardens.The room and bathroom were a good size and very clean with good air con. Also the room had TV with CNN and BBC World News channels.They have a small restaurant were you can take your breakfast over looking the pool. The food is of a good standard and the whole hotel is managed very well by Belgian owners who live on site.The hotel is in an excellent location with lots of places to eat and shop and a five min walk to the beach and yet it was very peaceful.If you like small boutique hotels it would be hard to get better value than this and we would have no hestiation in returning.
Reviews.Author: Freoman

Reviews.Content: Great Tamukami Spent 2 nights at the Tamukami in Sept. 2004. The small attractive property is located back away from the main road. Rooms are large, modern and clean. Rooms even have TV, which can be rare in smaller Bali hotels. Excellent restaurant with nightclub acts too. Plenty of shops  restaurants nearby. Great massage place across the street down a couple of blocks. Sanur is a much smaller version of Kuta, but more upscale  much quieter. Good base to visit southern Bali  Ubud.
Reviews.Author: avio

Reviews.Content: 渚℃牸銇壊銈娿伀銇勩亜閮ㄥ眿   showReview(19170525, 'full');
Reviews.Author: lass=
